page.title: 02 Local History ONE
page.content: During a visit to the church of St Mary the Virgin in Pillerton Hersey we discovered that the village used to be a Saxon settlement called Pillhard.In the previous Domesday Book in was mentioned as Pillhardington.The word Hersey comes from Hugh,de Hersey to whom the village was granted to him in 1193 by Richard 1.In Pillerton Priors (Pillerton Hersey's neighbouring village) there used to be a church dedicated to St Mary Magdeline.In 1666 Prince Rupert burnt the church down on his way to the battle of Edgehill.The roof of the nave was carved in the (15th century.)The roof of the chancel has hammer beams.There are three bells one was made in 1602,another in 1668 and the last in 1672.
